summary: Can bad guys be kept from billing Medicare? Screening doctors and other providers to make sure they are legitimate helps. In 2011 Medicare strengthened its screening process—for example, by visiting more doctors' offices to verify information and conducting more background checks. As a result, over 700,000 medical providers lost their Medicare billing privileges, saving an estimated $2.4 billion. But the screening process could work even...
title: Medicare: Initial Results of Revised Process to Screen Providers and Suppliers, and Need for Objectives and Performance Measures
